pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Relax name checking, warn and modify frame names in Model, World Load

pull_request.title: [Citadel] Relax name checking, warn and modify frame names in Model, World Load

update.description:
The name checking was much too strict, any xml elements with matching name attributes  that are direct children of model or world were generating errors and causing the DOM loading to fail. This includes `//model/plugin/@name`, and there are many of these collisions in ign-gazebo.

It now warns for any xml elements with matching name attributes. The build*Graph functions now check for collisions among frame names before adding a frame to the graph, rather than checking the XML siblings of all frame elements. Also, I've modified `Model::Load` and `World::Load` to warn and modify any non-compliant Frame or Joint names by appending `_frame` or `_joint` and then appending incrementing integers until a unique name is found.
update.title: [Citadel] Relax name checking, warn and modify frame names in Model, World Load

content.raw:
yes, I remember having this discussion before about error severity:

* #!/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/411/add-inertial-parsing/diff#comment-55959397
* #!/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/411/add-inertial-parsing/diff#comment-55961300

I agree that it's better for the users to try to automatically work-around errors, but I think it might take some design work to get right

pull_request.title: [Citadel] Relax name checking, warn and modify frame names in Model, World Load

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Relax name checking, warn and modify frame names in Model, World Load

content.raw:
tl;dr Ok, let's keep it like this

---

Ok, yeah it fails on SDF8 too. But it feels a bit too extreme not to load the whole world because of that, no? This concern goes beyond this case though, I think any errors loading a model will end up failing the world.

In any case, just as a reference, Gazebo-classic allowed homonymous sibling links. It has a bunch of silent failures as a consequence though.
content.html:
tl;dr Ok, let's keep it like this

Ok, yeah it fails on SDF8 too. But it feels a bit too extreme not to load the whole world because of that, no? This concern goes beyond this case though, I think any errors loading a model will end up failing the world.

In any case, just as a reference, Gazebo-classic allowed homonymous sibling links. It has a bunch of silent failures as a consequence though.

content.raw: two sibling links with the same name are not allowed in sdf 1.6, and I believe that type of model wouldn't load in sdformat8
content.html: two sibling links with the same name are not allowed in sdf 1.6, and I believe that type of model wouldn't load in sdformat8

pull_request.title: [Citadel] Relax name checking, warn and modify frame names in Model, World Load

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Relax name checking, warn and modify frame names in Model, World Load

content.raw:
I'm testing a world on `ign-gazebo` with 2 sibling links named the same, and that's preventing the world from being loaded:

~~~
Warning [Model.cc:241] Non-unique names detected in XML children of model with name[box].
[Err] [Server.cc:198] Error Code 2 Msg: link with name[box] already exists.
[Err] [Server.cc:198] Error Code 8 Msg: Failed to load a world.
~~~

I haven't looked too deeply, but my understanding is that the presence of any errors will prevent loading the DOM.
content.html:
I'm testing a world on ign-gazebo with 2 sibling links named the same, and that's preventing the world from being loaded:

Warning [Model.cc:241] Non-unique names detected in XML children of model with name[box].
[Err] [Server.cc:198] Error Code 2 Msg: link with name[box] already exists.
[Err] [Server.cc:198] Error Code 8 Msg: Failed to load a world.

I haven't looked too deeply, but my understanding is that the presence of any errors will prevent loading the DOM.

The name checking was much too strict, any xml elements with matching name attributes  that are direct children of model or world were generating errors and causing the DOM loading to fail. This includes `//model/plugin/@name`, and there are many of these collisions in ign-gazebo.

It now warns for any xml elements with matching name attributes. Also, I've modified `Model::Load` and `World::Load` to warn and modify any non-compliant Frame or Joint names by appending `_frame` or `_joint` and then appending incrementing integers until a unique name is found.
